ages.formula:
"10 years ago, a father was four times as old as his son. 10 years hence, he will be twice as old his son. Find the son's present age.

Solution:

Let the father's present age be F and the son's age be S.

10 years ago:
F - 10 = 4(S - 10)
F - 10 = 4S - 40
F = 4S - 30

10 years hence:
F + 10 = 2(S + 10)
F + 10 = 2S + 20
F - 2S = 10

Replacing F with (4S - 30):
(4S - 30) - 2S = 10
2S = 40
S = 20

Son's present age is 20 years."

tests.text: The ratio of the ages of A and B is 2:3. If B is 3 years elder than A, find the age of A after 2 years.
Two years ago, A was thrice as old as B. Two years later, A will be twice as old as B. Find the present age of B.

In a family of four, the average age is 20. The parents' age difference is 5 and the siblings' age difference is 4. If the ages of the eldest and yougest member differ by 33, find the age of the youngest member of the family.
A is 5 years elder than B who is 4 years elder than C. The sum of their ages is 61. Find the age of B.

The sum of the ages of a mother and a son is equal to the age of the father. Three years later, the father will be six times as old as his son. The ratio of the present ages of the mother and son is 10:1. Find the age of the father.
A and B are twins. The sum of their ages combined with their father's age is 47. Their father's age at the time of their birth was 29. Find the age of A.
Thirteen years back, my mother was thrice my age and two years back, she was twice my age. Find my mother's present age.
A man has three daughters. The present ages of all three of them are square numbers. The sum of their ages after 5 years is 41. Find the age of his eldest daughter after 2 years.
A wizard named Gaylord says "I am only three times my son's age. My father is 40 years more than twice my age. Together the three of us are a mere 1240 years old". How old is Gaylord?
A father is three times as old as his son. After fifteen years the father will be twice as old as his son's age at that time. Hence the father's present age is...

On a man's tombstone, it is said that one sixth of his life was spent in childhood and one twelfth as a teenager. One seventh of his life passed between the time he bacame an adult and the time he married; five years later his son was born. The son died four years before he did. He lived to be twice as old as his son did. How old did the man live to be?
In a group of 4 friends, P is the eldest and R is the youngest. Neither is of the same age as the others. The sum of the ages of R and S is greater than twice the age of Q. Who is the second eldest?
At present, A is twice as old as B. Three years back, A was thrice the age of B. Find B's present age.
Today is A's birthday. One year from today, A will be twice as old as he was 10 years ago. How old is A today?
The ages of A and B are in ratio of 5:3. If A is 8 years elder than B, find the age of B.
The present ages of A and B differ by 7. Five years back, B was twice the age of A. Find the age of A after 4 years.
A is three years older than B who is five years older than C. The sum of their ages is 73. Find the age of B.
5 years ago, 1/5th of A's age was equal to 1/7th of B's age. The average of their present ages is 29. Find A's age after 5 years.
The average age of two brothers in a family is 21. The average drops to 19 when the age of the third brother is also included. Find the age of the third brother.
The difference between the ages of A and C is half the age of B. The difference between the ages of A and B is one-sixth of the age of C. If the sum of the ages of B and C is 32, find the age of A.
The present ages of three people in a family are in the ratio 3:5:7. If the sum of their ages before 5 years was 60, find the age of the youngest.
The ratio of the ages of a mother and a daughter are in the ratio 3:1. The product of their ages is 363. Find the daughter's age after 4 years.
A father's age is two and a half times more than his son's age. 5 years ago, he was six times the age of his son. Find the father's present age.
A boy said to his friends, "When I was born, my father was as old as I am now". If his father's age will be 60 after 6 years, find the son's present age.
The ages of A and B are in the ratio 4:5. 4 years ago, their ages were in the ratio 8:11. Find A's present age.
A boy is 8 years older than his sister. Two years ago, he was twice his sister's age. Find his present age.
The sum of the ages of A and B is twice the difference of their ages. Find the ratio of B's to A's age.
Five years ago, the sum of my age and my mother's age was equal to my father's age. If my father is 6 years elder than my mother, find my present age.
A is twice B's age. After 10 years, B will be two-third of A's age. Find A's present age.
A is 9 years older than B. Two years ago, B's age was half that of A's. Find B's present age.
In 10 years, A will be twice as old as B was 10 years ago. If A is now 9 years older than B, the present age of B is...
At the end of 1994, A was half as old as his grandmother. The sum of the years in which they were born is 3844. How old was A at the end of 1999?
The present ages of A,B and C are in the ratio of 3:5:8. Eight years ago, the sum of their ages was 40. Find B's present age.

My brother is 5 years elder to me. My father was 30 years of age when my sister was born while my mother was 32 years of age when I was born. If my sister was 5 years of age when my brother was born, then what was the age of my father when my brother was born?
A's father was 32 years of age when he was born while his mother was 29 years old when his sister three years younger to him was born. What is the difference between the ages of his parents?
The ages of two person P and Q differ by 14 years. 6 years ago, P was thrice as old as Q. Find the present age of Q.
The total age of X and Y is 10 years more than the total age of Y and Z. Find the difference between the ages of X and Z.

A grand father has 3 grand children. Age difference of the two younger children is 3. The age of the eldest child is 3 times the age of the youngest child and also two years more than the sum of the ages of the other two children. What is the age of the eldest child?
A father's age was five times his son's age 5 years ago and will be three times the son's age after 2 years. What is the ratio of their present ages?
The ratio of the age of a man and his wife is 4:3. After 4 years, this ratio will be 9:7. If at the time of marriage, the ratio was 7:5, then how many years ago were they married?
A is younger than B by 7 years. If their ages are in the respective ratio of 7:9, how old is A?
The ratio of the ages of A and B is 4:3. The sum of their ages is 28 years. The ratio of their ages after 8 years will be...
The ratio of the age of A and the age of B is 3:5 and the sum of their ages is 80 years. The ratio of their ages after 10 years will be...
Q is as much youger than R as he is older than T. If the sum of the ages of R and T is 50 years, find the difference between the ages of R and Q.
A is as much younger to B as he is older to C. If the sum of the ages of B and C is 48 years, what is the age of A
The sum of the ages of A and B is 45 years. Five years ago, the product of their ages was four times the age of A at that time. The present ages of A and B, respectively are...
The ratio of A's age to B's age is equal to 4:3. A will be 26 years old after 6 years. How old is B now?

One year ago, a mother was four times as old as her daughter. Six years hence, the age of the mother will exceed twice the age of her daughter by 9 years. The ratio of the present ages of the mother and her daughter is...
A was twice as old as B, 10 years back. How old is B today, if A will be 40 years old, 10 years hence?
A was thrice as old as B, 6 years back. A will be 5/3 times as old as B 6 years hence. How old is B today?

If 6 years are subtracted from the present age of A and the remainder is divided by 18, then the present age of his grandson is obtained. If the grandson is 2 years younger to a friend of him whose age is 5 years, then what is the present age of A?
The ages of A and B are in the ratio of 3:5. After 9 years, the ratio of their ages will becomes 3:4. The present age of B is...
The total of the ages of X, Y and Z at present is 90 years. Ten years ago, the ratio of their ages was 1:2:3. What is the age of Y at present?
A's mother was 5 times older than him, 8 years ago. She would be 3 times of his age, 2 years from now. Find the present ratio of the ages of A and his mother.
A is twice as old as B was two years ago. If the difference between their ages is 2 years, how old is A today?
The age of A's mother is 4 times his age. If 5 years ago, the mother's age was 7 times the age of her son at the time, what is A's mother present age?
The average age of 10 students is 20 years. If the age of one more student is included, the average decreases by 1. What is the age of the new student?
Five years ago, A's age was one-third of the age of B and now A's age is 17 years. What is the present age of B?

The sum of the ages of A, B and C is 96 years. To find the age of B, which of the following information given in the statements P and Q is/are sufficient?

P: A is 6 years older than C.
Q: The sum of the ages of B and C is 56 years.
The age of A is 3 times that of B. In 12 years, the age of A will be double the age of B. Find the present age of A.
In 10 years, A will be twice as old as B was 10 years ago. If A is now 9 years older than B, the present age of B is...
A is 4 times as old as his son. Four years hence, the sum of their ages will be 43 years. The present age of his son is...
The sum of the ages of A and his father is 56 years. After 4 years, the age of the father will be three times A's age. Their ages respectively are...
